# Path and Surface Unification

## Overview
Currently paths and surfaces are separate concepts in the codebase, but they share fundamental similarities:
- Both map from a parameter space to world space
- Both need to handle connections/transitions
- Both need geometric information at points

This task proposes unifying them under a common framework based on the coordinate system design in coord.hpp.

## Current State
- Surfaces are 2D constructs defined by function objects (position, derivatives, etc.)
- Paths are 1D constructs with different implementations (GeodesicCurve, PathSegment, TransitionPath)
- Both use different approaches for composition (SurfaceCollection vs TransitionPath)
- GeometryPoint2 bundles surface information but has no path equivalent

## Proposed Changes

### 1. Create Unified Manifold Base
```cpp
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class Manifold {
public:
    // ParamDim is dimension of parameter space (1 for paths, 2/3 for surfaces)
    // TargetDim is dimension of target space (2 or 3 for world space)
    // SpaceTag is WorldSpaceTag or ParamSpaceTag for target space
    
    static_assert(ParamDim >= 1 && ParamDim <= 3, "Parameter space must be 1D, 2D, or 3D");
    static_assert(TargetDim >= 2 && TargetDim <= 3, "Target space must be 2D or 3D");
    static_assert(ParamDim <= TargetDim || SpaceTag == ParamSpaceTag, 
                 "Parameter dimension cannot exceed target dimension in world space");
    
    using ParameterPoint = Coord<ParamDim, PointTag, ParamSpaceTag>;
    using TargetPoint = Coord<TargetDim, PointTag, SpaceTag>;
    
    // Core evaluation function
    virtual TargetPoint evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const = 0;
    
    // Derivatives and geometric properties
    virtual std::vector<TargetPoint> derivatives(const ParameterPoint& param) const = 0;
    virtual RiemannianMetric metric(const ParameterPoint& param) const = 0;
};
```

### 2. Refactor Surface as Manifold Specialization
```cpp
// 3D World Space Surfaces
using Surface3D = Manifold<2, 3, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 2D param -> 3D world
using Surface3DParam3 = Manifold<3, 3, WorldSpaceTag>; // 3D param -> 3D world

// 2D World Space Surfaces (for future use)
using Surface2D = Manifold<2, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;    // 2D param -> 2D world

// Parameter Space Surfaces
using ParameterSurface2D = Manifold<2, 2, ParamSpaceTag>; // 2D -> 2D param
using ParameterSurface3D = Manifold<3, 3, ParamSpaceTag>; // 3D -> 3D param
```

### 3. Define Path Types Similarly
```cpp
// World Space Paths
using WorldPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>;  // 1D -> 3D world
using WorldPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, WorldSpaceTag>;  // 1D -> 2D world

// Parameter Space Paths
using ParamPath2D = Manifold<1, 2, ParamSpaceTag>;  // 1D -> 2D param
using ParamPath3D = Manifold<1, 3, ParamSpaceTag>;  // 1D -> 3D param
```

### 4. Unify Geometric Information
Replace GeometryPoint2 with a template:
```cpp
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class GeometricPoint {
    const Manifold<ParamDim, TargetDim, SpaceTag>* manifold_;
    Coord<ParamDim, PointTag, ParamSpaceTag> local_pos_;
    // ... geometric properties
};
```

### 5. Unified Collection/Connection System
```cpp
template<int ParamDim, int TargetDim, typename SpaceTag>
class ManifoldCollection {
    // Handles connections between manifolds of same dimensions
    // Replaces both SurfaceCollection and path transition logic
};
```

## Implementation Steps

The templating transformation will be done in stages, verifying build and tests after each stage:

1. Stage 1: Coordinate System ✓
   - coord.hpp already provides templated point/vector types
   - All coordinate-related tests pass

2. Stage 2: Manifold Base and Geometric Point ✓
   - Created manifold.hpp with basic template structure
   - Created geometric_point.hpp to replace GeometryPoint2
   - Updated coding conventions to reflect new architecture
   - Next: Update surface.hpp to use new types
   - Next: Verify space_transformation_tests pass

3. Stage 3: Surface Implementation (In Progress) ✓
   - Created Surface3D class inheriting from Manifold<2,3,WorldSpaceTag> ✓
   - Implemented coordinate transformations with proper validation ✓
   - Added SurfaceAdapter to maintain backward compatibility ✓
   - Verified space_transformation_tests pass ✓
   - Updated remaining surface implementations (cube.hpp, sphere_surface.hpp) ✓
   - Completed path creation functionality ✓
     - Created Path3D base class inheriting from Manifold<1,3,WorldSpaceTag>
     - Updated path.hpp and path.cpp to use new manifold-based types
     - Maintained backward compatibility through evaluate() methods
   - Added tests to verify manifold interface ✓
     - Created manifold_tests.cpp with interface verification
     - Added coordinate transformation tests
     - Verified compatibility with existing functionality
   - Stage 3 complete ✓

4. Stage 4: Path Implementation (Next)
   - Convert path classes to use appropriate Manifold specialization
   - Update path implementations to use new framework
   - Verify path tests (will likely need updates)

5. Stage 5: Collections and Connections
   - Create ManifoldCollection template
   - Migrate SurfaceCollection functionality
   - Add path transition support
   - Verify all connection-related tests

6. Stage 6: RiemannianMetric Template (Optional)
   - Convert RiemannianMetric to template if needed
   - Implement dimension-specific operations
   - Can be deferred if current implementation works

## Benefits
1. More consistent and maintainable codebase
2. Shared infrastructure for paths and surfaces
3. Better type safety through templates
4. Easier to add new types of manifolds
5. Unified approach to connections and transitions

## Risks & Mitigation
1. Large-scale refactor touching many files
   - Break into smaller, testable changes
   - Maintain backward compatibility during transition

2. Performance impact of templates
   - Use type aliases to maintain readability
   - Profile key operations before/after

3. Increased complexity of base classes
   - Document design decisions
   - Use clear naming conventions
   - Add runtime checks in debug builds

## Files to Modify
- include/shap/surface.hpp
- include/shap/path.hpp
- include/shap/geometry_point2.hpp
- include/shap/surface_collection.hpp
- src/surface.cpp
- src/path.cpp
- src/surface_collection.cpp
- tests/*

## New Files to Create
- include/shap/manifold.hpp
- include/shap/geometric_point.hpp
- include/shap/manifold_collection.hpp
- src/manifold.cpp
- tests/manifold_tests.cpp

<content>#include "shap/path3d.hpp"
#include <stdexcept>

namespace shap {

GeometricPoint<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>
Path3D::evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    
    // Get geometric vectors
    const auto pos = position_(t);
    const auto tan = tangent_(t);
    const auto norm = normal_(t);
    const auto binorm = tan.cross(norm);
    
    return GeometricPoint<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>(
        this,
        param,
        pos,
        std::vector<TargetVector>{tan},
        // Additional geometric info
        {{"normal", norm}, {"binormal", binorm}}
    );
}

std::vector<TargetVector>
Path3D::derivatives(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return {tangent_(t)};
}

TargetVector
Path3D::normal(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return normal_(t);
}

TargetVector
Path3D::binormal(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return tangent_(t).cross(normal_(t));
}

double
Path3D::get_param_value(const ParameterPoint& param) {
    validate_parameters(param);
    return param[0];
}

} // namespace shap
</content>
</write_to_file>

<content>#include "shap/path3d.hpp"
#include <stdexcept>

namespace shap {

GeometricPoint<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>
Path3D::evaluate(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    
    // Get geometric vectors
    const auto pos = position_(t);
    const auto tan = tangent_(t);
    const auto norm = normal_(t);
    const auto binorm = tan.cross(norm);
    
    return GeometricPoint<1, 3, WorldSpaceTag>(
        this,
        param,
        pos,
        std::vector<WorldVector3>{tan}
    );
}

std::vector<WorldVector3>
Path3D::derivatives(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return {tangent_(t)};
}

WorldVector3
Path3D::normal(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return normal_(t);
}

WorldVector3
Path3D::binormal(const ParameterPoint& param) const {
    const double t = get_param_value(param);
    return tangent_(t).cross(normal_(t));
}

double
Path3D::get_param_value(const ParameterPoint& param) {
    validate_parameters(param);
    return param[0];
}

} // namespace shap
</content>
